page.title: 06MEMORIES OF WARTIME
page.content: During the Second World War Perton was a Royal Air Force practice and training airfield. The field measured some fifty acres and abandoned by the Authorities in July 1947. The field had an Airdrome a Control Tower and a variety of workshond residential huts. Although the history of the field dated back to 1916 units based here did not see active service. In 1941 the fiedl was used as a Parachue Training School. Then in 1942 a sqadron of 'Oxfords' were based at the arfield. Towards the end of its history the field was used as an aircraft testing ground for a nearby engine makers. Abondoned in 1947 private aircraft flew from the field before it was returned to agriculture and developed.
